snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority has for the first time proposed a formal set of rules for renaming subway stops.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority has, for first time, proposed formal set of rules for renaming its facilities, and more subway stations could eventually bear names of wealthy sponsors; officials say that given authority's need for revenue streams, option could not be overlooked.
lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority has for the first time proposed a formal set of rules for renaming subway stops.

headline.main: M.T.A. Considers Selling Rights to Name Subway  Stations
headline.print_headline: Selling Right To Put Name On a Station Is Explored
